service.tut.pori.apilta.sensors.reference

Class BackendService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.tut.pori.apilta.sensors.reference.BackendService

public class BackendService
extends java.lang.Object
    Reference implementation for Back-end APIs

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        @HTTPServiceMethod(name="addTask",
                   acceptedMethods="POST")
public void addTask(@HTTPAuthenticationParameter(required=false)
                                                                                                    core.tut.pori.http.parameters.AuthenticationParameter authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                    @HTTPMethodParameter(name="body",bodyParameter=true)
                                                                                                    core.tut.pori.http.parameters.InputStreamParameter xml)
        The request is to be sent in the body of POST method. The Content-Type header MUST be set to "text/xml". The character set MUST be UTF-8. For example, "Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8".

        Example Query:

        POST /rest/cserb/"addTask"
        Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8

        [HTTP BODY STARTS]
        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<task>
  <createdTimestamp>2018-03-22T06:37:35Z</createdTimestamp>
  <description>ynopsndncbsxbayoltfvfzbydflrpmcrrvyxsrnybdmtzoocxfehugfpxhccwqzl</description>
  <dataVisibility>PUBLIC</dataVisibility>
  <name>wqakkavycdhijoicqascudxbniyogzfutgbijskuktpptpyvddpaksvnzxvngato</name>
  <taskState>INACTIVE</taskState>
  <taskIdList>
    <taskId>1ff9f68c-b9d7-4d8c-84a7-6fc0b15d4572</taskId>
  </taskIdList>
  <taskTypeList>
    <taskType>gather</taskType>
  </taskTypeList>
  <updatedTimestamp>2019-02-04T06:07:39Z</updatedTimestamp>
  <userDetails>
    <userId>3340384237645527307</userId>
  </userDetails>
  <backendList>
    <backend>
      <backendId>8251117437040202382</backendId>
    </backend>
  </backendList>
  <callbackUri>http://example.org:8080/ApiltaService/rest/sensors/taskFinished</callbackUri>
  <when>
    <condition>
      <terms>
        <entry>
          <key>beoxr</key>
          <value>wexfulcvqa</value>
        </entry>
        <entry>
          <key>rkfqp</key>
          <value>bbwjhzyrvo</value>
        </entry>
        <entry>
          <key>time/validFromToRange</key>
          <value>2018-03-13T17:03:27.315Z/2019-03-26T08:28:20.315Z</value>
        </entry>
      </terms>
    </condition>
  </when>
  <what>
    <output>
      <feature>iiiys</feature>
    </output>
    <output>
      <feature>dedup</feature>
    </output>
  </what>
</task>

        [HTTP BODY ENDS]

        Example Result:

        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<response method="addTask" service="cserb">
  <status>OK</status>
</response>
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        xml - Only the workload data should be in the body. See SensorTask

      • queryTaskStatus

        @HTTPServiceMethod(name="queryTaskStatus",
                   acceptedMethods="GET")
public core.tut.pori.http.Response queryTaskStatus(@HTTPAuthenticationParameter(required=false)
                                                                                                                                          core.tut.pori.http.parameters.AuthenticationParameter authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                          @HTTPMethodParameter(name="task_id")
                                                                                                                                          core.tut.pori.http.parameters.LongParameter taskId,
                                                                                                                                          @HTTPMethodParameter(name="data_groups",required=false)
                                                                                                                                          core.tut.pori.http.parameters.DataGroups dataGroups,
                                                                                                                                          @HTTPMethodParameter(name="limits",required=false)
                                                                                                                                          core.tut.pori.http.parameters.Limits limits)
        This method can be used to query the current status of a sensor task from the back-end.

        Example Query:

        GET /rest/cserb/"queryTaskStatus"?"task_id"=1

        Example Result:

        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<response method="queryTaskStatus" service="cserb">
  <task>
    <dataVisibility>PUBLIC</dataVisibility>
    <taskIdList>
      <taskId>87e6ba0c-97ef-4de8-9596-7493d7fe33b3</taskId>
    </taskIdList>
    <taskTypeList>
      <taskType>gather</taskType>
    </taskTypeList>
    <backendList>
      <backend>
        <backendId>6970949262364562110</backendId>
        <message>dasvbccbiaucsjhakvxrlipoqsrbirdzuwkqdvkzkbsdjmkxxrstxxtqijquvkkb</message>
        <taskStatus>NOT_STARTED</taskStatus>
      </backend>
    </backendList>
    <callbackUri>http://example.org:8080/ApiltaService/rest/sensors/taskFinished</callbackUri>
    <measurementList>
      <measurement>
        <backendId>6970949262364562110</backendId>
        <measurementId>89137b08-160e-4b45-9be4-e53eded262d9</measurementId>
      </measurement>
    </measurementList>
  </task>
  <status>OK</status>
</response>
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        taskId -
        dataGroups -
        limits - paging limits
        Returns:
        See SensorTask
